intro: Rhinanthus cretaceus, commonly known as the Crete goldenweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It is an annual herb that typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Rhinanthus cretaceus is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained environments.
